actions.recommendation: Supplement with active B vitamins (eg. Phytomulti) to reduce homocysteine levels.

Pay attention to the modifiable risk factors to lower your risk for heart disease. Your father had a heart attack at a young age but he was a smoker etc. So although genetics can play a role, paying attention to your lifestyle is more important. Pay attention to improving your diet, losing some weight especially around your abdomen and continue exercising.

Raised HsCRP levels indicate inflammation, which can put you at higher risk for chronic disease. To reduce inflammation pay attention to lowering stress levels, exercising and eating an anti-inflammatory diet such as the mediterranean style diet. Weight loss around the abdomen will also help and can Omega 3 supplementation.
Mildly raised uric acid levels may be insignificant but can lead towards gout and heart disease. Watch alcohol intake and red meat consumption.
Focus on stress management as this came through in the results and in our discussion.
Please follow the advice regarding supplementation and lifestyle modifications which need to take place and retest at the recommended time intervals.
Take Multivitamin and Mineral supplement (Multivitamin and Mineral 100mg) daily.
Take Omega-3 fish oil supplement (1000mg) daily.
Consider a PSA test for prostate cancer screening (Not specified).
Consider a colonoscopy for colorectal cancer screening (Not specified).
